website_summaries.verdict: An unusual but fun tricycle meant for bigger kids.
pros: Provides hours of fun for slightly older kids
cons: Only for children over age five due to complexity of "drift" feature

customer_reviews.title: great durability
customer_reviews.text: Years of great use , still being used today. The seat is the only thing that has broken, nothing a little ducktape couldnt fixed. Keep in mind this has neen store out side in ca the hole time.
customer_reviews.author: anthony marquez

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my almost 10 year old daughter. She is small enough yet not too big (55 inches) for it. She has a blast zipping around on it. It is hard to control since it has caster wheels on the back , so I wouldn't recommend it for too young of a child. It's nice to have a friend or sibling that gets one too. They can zip around together. The only problem I have with it is, that it doesn't have brakes, so you have to stop with your feet , wearing the bottom of your shoes off.
customer_reviews.author: lisaduka

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Birthday Gift!!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the various reviews, I ordered the Rip-Rider for my son's 6th birthday. I read that someone was terribly disappointed whose son was only 35.5 because he could not reach the petals. My son measured in at 45.5 inches tall so I rolled the dice. He LOVES it!! We do put a very small pillow in the seat back behind him and with that he does fantastic! As others have experienced, immediately after we put it together and took it outside, he and my 9 year old daughter started fighting over it! It's a great riding toy, very sturdy and extremely easy to put together! I definitely give it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Joyous

customer_reviews.title: Fun trike
customer_reviews.text: My 30-year-old daughter has a lot of fun on this my grand children tend to be scared but so far it is a lot of fun
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun rider but pick another brand
customer_reviews.text: I find that razor products are great for awhile (Not long enough) but they usually have something wrong very quickly and this was not an exception. The concept is great and my grandkids loved it while it lasted. Replacement parts are expensive so not worth the investment. I found this out the hard and expensive way with my razor scooters. The wheels broke on this rip-rider very quickly under normal use. Very dissapointing and I have resisted the urge to buy razor products anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy hu

customer_reviews.title: kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: we're an active family and have all kinds of outdoor toys for the kids but this probably gets the most use when we're just hanging out. the kids fight over it, from the 3 year old (still a bit big) to the 9 year old (a bit small)...and not to mention when their friends come over...they line up for this thing. front tire wears out fast. i wish there was a rubber replacement tire instead of the plastic(?) one that it comes with. get a safety flag (about [...] at you lbs) if you're riding in the street. overall, it's an excellent buy!
customer_reviews.author: fundaddysaurus

customer_reviews.title: Insanely jealous these don't come in adult sizes
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a child at Christmas over two years ago. It was easy to put together and every time I see a kid on it, I really wish I could ride it too! It's held up well and my child still rides it (and fits it and I'm certain to pass it down to his siblings once he finally does outgrow it). For maximum enjoyment I recommend that you have a flat wide-open alphalt or concrete space where your kid can perform spins and tricks ad nauseum - it sits low and is not ideal for any sort of travel to and fro.
customer_reviews.author: MWM

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 8-year old son and he loves it. It got him off the computer and outside - need I say more. My 10-year old daughter uses it as well. Well constructed and very easy to put together. You pedal then spin out safely. If they made one for adults - I would have one. Other parents have seen it and say the same thing. Would be even better if it came with a bright orange flag to warn motorist since it sits low to the ground - but with basic parental supervision, this is a fun and safe rider that should last for years.
customer_reviews.author: JAGMAN

customer_reviews.title: 6 year old son loves it
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this!! I am nervous to get this for my sons birthday. He turned 6 this past summer. He became and expert on this on the first day. He flies around on this thing like he has owned it for months. He loves it. I don't think it would be for everyone as the back end fish tails all over the place and somehow my son figured out how to control it and drives it great. I think I would be scared to drive this around flying side to side but my son loves it. I would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Exciting ride - kids love this - Adults want to ride too
customer_reviews.text: At first the 5 and 6 year old were tentative. The swing of this bike was a little scary. After a few rides - they were trying to see who could get it to spin the most. Now all the kids on the street are fighting to ride this. It was easy to set up right out of the box. Would be nice to be able to move the seat closer or further away to adjust for the size. Smaller kids cannot reach the pedals. The 3 and 4 year olds want to do the same things as the big kids. I expect more kids will be getting these this summer. They want to race.
customer_reviews.author: DO Lists

customer_reviews.title: Great for reluctant bike riders!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 7 but is more like a 10 year old in size. She needs to get her exercise but refused to ride a bike while my youngest 2 were zooming around on their big wheels. We finally got the idea that she didn't like the height of being up on a bicycle so we started looking for "big Wheels" for bigger kids. We finally found this bike and now she is riding all the time!!! We are so happy for her and it's a joy to see her have fun with her siblings! Worth every pennny to us.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wincovitch

customer_reviews.title: My grandson LOVES this bike
customer_reviews.text: LOVES LOVES LOVES and rides it as his choice over his other ones. Easy to ride, the 360 turns are great fun. Other kids love the bike and are always asking to take a ride in it. Even adults are loving this bike. I'd give it 5 stars except that there aren't brakes and he has to use his sneaker heels to stop plus when he is using on sidewalk often slide into grass or stones where the little wheels stop dead.
customer_reviews.author: P. A. Owens

customer_reviews.title: So much fun! I wish they made adult size!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my youngest son 2 years ago. He was 4 at the time and my other son was 7. They both LOVE riding it. The first time it spun they were both surprised. They take turns riding it when we take family walks and enjoy spinning around. It is much easier to maneuver than a traditional big wheel and the rear wheels last much longer than the traditional hollow plastic wheels. It looks like so much fun, I wish they would make a larger size so I could try it!
customer_reviews.author: Preciousgio

customer_reviews.title: Fun for both Big and Small Kids
customer_reviews.text: The Rip Rider is just plain fun. I literally had to set up a stopwatch in my driveway so that my three boys (ages 7, 9 and 11) could share. They love to spin out, and I like that it seems really stable, and is relatively quiet as compared to an old-style "big wheel." Because of the spin-out feature, they need less room in which to ride, which is handy. assembly took all of 15 minutes, not too taxing at all. I would highly recommend the Razor Rip-Rider 360.
customer_reviews.author: Lifelong Learner

customer_reviews.title: Hit of the neighborhood!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Razor Rip-Rider for Christmas 2012 for my 6 year old (50lbs). He rode it around the house a bit, then came the Spring weather. OH boy was this a hit for all the neighborhood kids! They were lined up at our house taking turns on the sidewalks and driveways. WHAT FUN!! We haven't had any issues in the (near) year of ownership, but the front tire looks a bit more bald now. I would say it has been ridden nearly daily. Great buy! He loves it! We have more than gotten our money's worth!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel A

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun!!!! Would buy again!!
customer_reviews.text: Great "big wheel" that spins. We definitely got our moneys worth out of this product!! You can ride it like a big wheel but put on the brakes after going pretty fast and you will spin out! Kids loved it! My only disappointment was that the back wheels are just casters and after ALOT of use eventually those back casters break. This lasted for years before they broke. My kids are now too big for it anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3 Boys

customer_reviews.title: love, love, love these
customer_reviews.text: we have 5 boys and we bought a couple of these for them for christmas. oh my goodness, they are a blast! even my husband and i could ride them! (they have a 160 pound weight limit). you can get them going really fast and pull a full 360 spin when you make a hard turn. so, so fun! my 4 year old can reach the pedals if he sits forward in the seat, my 2 year old can't reach the pedals, but doesn't mind, and it's perfect for my 6 and 7 year old boys. i almost wish we had bought a few more.
customer_reviews.author: M. Prince

customer_reviews.title: Fun, dependable and long lasting!
customer_reviews.text: I am posting this review almost 8 years after my purchase. Both Razors are still going strong and have been through multiple kids. This was a fantastic purchase. I am just replacing my first wheel after over 7 1/2 years!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mills

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my son for his 6th birthday a couple of months ago. It was definitely money well spent! He rides it every single day and never gets tired of it. He has mastered the spinning and I have even had people stop to watch him ride it. It's a really awesome bike and it has been very durable. My 190 lb. 30 year old brother even rode it and it held his weight with no problem. It's pricey but it's worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: BBond81

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. Rarely rides his two wheel bike these days. He loves the spinning. Some of the other kids have been allowed to ride it (in the short time my son is taking a break), and they've given mixed reviews. I do require kids to wear elbow pads and we ride on flat surface area. I would not recommend this be use on hills as it has no breaks and control is lost when you decide to spin.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of 5

customer_reviews.title: great for 9 yr. old boy
customer_reviews.text: who is average height and weight. I was afraid he'd be too old for this toy but it is just perfect for him. At the furthest point, his leg is fully extended while pedaling. His legs are not crowded at any point. He makes VERY FAST spins. It is a little difficult to keep it going in a straight line, which is sometimes required on sidewalks, since the back wheels float all the way around (360 degrees) but it doesn't seem to be a problem for the kids. It just adds to the fun. Great toy.
customer_reviews.author: Kwisatz Haderach

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 8 year old son for his birthday. He loved it! I would say good for ages 5 to 10. Unless they are tall. Hard to pedal if too tall. Although my 12 year old loves to try to ride it anyways. It is fun! It does not have brakes, so have to be careful if on a hill. It really spins in circles, which is what all the kids love! Would buy again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Schalk

customer_reviews.title: Best buy I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: It's time to make an adult Razor Rip-Rider 360 so the kids can ride in peace. Love this trike and so do the grandkids :) UPDATE: Best buy I've ever made for the grandkids. You can't go wrong with this trike or the one that "sparks" ( I bought both). The kids don't even look at their old bikes and it's always hard to get them to stop/ come in lol. They love being outside riding these. Love .. love .. love these trikes.
customer_reviews.author: usconstlvr

customer_reviews.title: Heck...I even had fun on this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I really did ride this thing. It is that strong. And what a blast! My 5 year old son rides it like a pro already and very fast. Its the only big wheel that I know of that will free wheel (the pedals dont have to spin with the wheel) adding to the ease of fun and tricks you can to. This also blows away the Radio Flyer version with a spin handle. That seems old school already and I will probably edit my review to point to this!
customer_reviews.author: Ringo

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller than it appears
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my children, ages 7 and 9. It should really be made clear that this toy is for children under 4 ft 4 inches. My son at 4 ft 6 inches is waaaay too tall, and it's basically a wasted toy. There is no way I can find to adjust it. And the speed of the turns are such that I wouldn't want a very young child riding it. So I guess that leaves a very small window of kids who are very small for their age. It's too bad, because this toy is not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: Razor Rip-Rider 360 Drifting Ride-On....Huge success!!!
customer_reviews.text: This Razor was a gift for my son who was 10 years old at the time. He loves it. It does 360's which is right up his alley. If you have a little thrill seaker like I do, this product is for you. I put this product together by myself in approximately one hour. It is holding up very well even though it is kept in the backyard exposed to weather. It has been over a year since he got this gift. He still uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our son who is 8. He loves it! Several of the kids in our cul de sac have them too and they have so much fun on them. It's like watching bumper cars. ha! Seems durable and strong. I even had to try it out for a minute and it feels like driving on ice and it's really fun to spin in a circle. I'd say it's best suited for kids ages 6+ as some won't be able to reach the peddles.
customer_reviews.author: Momofboys

customer_reviews.title: Good rider
customer_reviews.text: my grandson really loves this. it has been a good sturdy rider that has held up really well. He has a friend that rides it also and he is a bigger boy and it still has held up. A fun toy, my grand daughter likes to ride it also. well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: Best bike we've ever purchased. This is a fun versatile bike and lasts forever! Highly recommend this for any age. Our thirteen year old son loves to ride this and so does his dad. Fun twists and turns on a dime. Hours of enjoyment outside.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisandra Feagans

customer_reviews.title: Rip it UP!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my GOSH! I purchased this, knowing nothing about this. It was on my son's Christmas list and I though, "Holy Cow, I'm paying $81 for this? I hope it's worth it!" Oh man, my kids won't stay off of it. It was worth every penny. It's sturdy built. Easy assembly. It was packaged appropriately and shipped expediently. Will definitely use seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda L. Twitchell

customer_reviews.title: Soooo Much Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Our kids absolutely love these! We purchased 2 of them. Even though our son is getting too tall to ride it now, he still gets on it. It's so much fun for the kids and its fun to watch them playing on these. One of the best "toys" our kids have had. We have positively gotten our money's worth out of this as they are very durable and long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: catlvr

customer_reviews.title: All the kids love it
customer_reviews.text: IF YOU ARE BUYING THIS FOR A GIFT MAKE SURE YOU SAY SO ON AMAZON. I bought this for Christmas and on Saturday, UPS shows up with a box with a big bike on the side. Needless to say, had my son saw that, his Santa gift would have been ruined. But my review is on the bike and not shipping. My son loves this bike. So much fun. And all the neighbors love to borrow it too.
customer_reviews.author: C. Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Kids Absolutely Love it
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old twins and 10 year old absolutely love this Razor Rip-Rider. The bike is well built, was easy to assemble, and is large enough for older kids too. The only concern I would have is that it is easy for the rider to get their fingers under the back wheels if they aren't on the steering wheel. For that reason I wouldn't recommend for kids under about 6 years or so.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Graber

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun!
customer_reviews.text: The Rip-Rider 360 Drifting Ride-On is the Big Wheels of this generation!! It is sturdy, safely constructed and easy to put together. This one was purchased for our grandson's 5th birthday, and he, as well as all of his friends, love it. To get the best ride, you need a fairly flat surface and a pretty good size area (two car width driveway is great). I wish it came in other colors--we'd buy a "fleet" of them!
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Tons for fun for 5-10 yr olds!
customer_reviews.text: The grandkids and their friends all love these things. They don't tip over easily (but kids still need to practice safety rules) and they can spin like crazy. All the kids from like these. The only negative is that the seat is not adjustable, so their legs have to be long enough to reach the pedals securely to get the control for great spins.
customer_reviews.author: SophieGolden

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun on hte Razor!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my older grandsons who did not like the old-fashioned big wheels. They LOVE it! It is larger in size so the seven year old can really zip around and it should be workable for him for a long time. It is too large for the younger boys. The leg length is quite long -- which is why they didn't like the Big Wheels ... thier legs were too cramped. They can go "really fast" and do some fun slides and turns. They boys all give it a thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for his 9th birthday! Best gift ever!!! I have 3 boys and even the "bad-attitude I'm too cool for anything 11 yr. old" loves it! I think I'm going to buy another for my 6 yr. old for Christmas because I can't stand the fighting! They can ride it outside and then in the basement when it's too cold and snowy! Definitely recommend this especially if you have active boys!!
customer_reviews.author: sammy

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy Every Neighborhood Kid Loves
customer_reviews.text: A neighbor got one of these, and every kid in the neighborhood loves it so we got one, too. Kids will spend hours with this - I would call it more of a "bigger" kids' Big Wheel, and the pivtoting back wheels really make it interesting and fun for them. You kids will more likely than not wear this thing out with hours and horus of use if they are like the kids aroundmy house!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Your kids will love this!
customer_reviews.text: Huge fan of Razor products and this item doesn't disappoint. Offers hours of entertainment for my 8 year old. He loves it and it's fun and keeps them active. With all of the ride on items the kids get lax in exercise and movement. This helps keep their legs moving while having a blast. And if your a small adult, you will love this too!
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: great fun but broke after 15 minutes of use
customer_reviews.text: My kids absolutely love this thing, big kids and little kids. Only problem is that the pedal fell off after 15 minutes (a factory pre-assembled part - nothing in your control). The construction of the pedal makes it impossible for you to put back on yourself. Razor has said they will send a new replacement front tire assembly, but that it is not available for 4-5 weeks. Am still in that window and haven't received it, so not sure if I am satisfied with the company's response yet. Overall, seems fun, slightly dangerous, make sure your kids wear a helmet when they ride it.
customer_reviews.author: julie a jaklic

customer_reviews.title: Razor Rip-Rider
customer_reviews.text: I got the Razor Rip-Rider as a birthday present for my grandson who was turning seven. It definitely was a big hit. It took about 10 minutes to put it together and then he was off and spinning. The only problem was his two siblings were jealous and wanted one too. I would recommend smaller children wearing a helmet, though, because they can spin this vehicle rather wildly and it's better to be safe in case they lose control.
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Rip Rider I've bought in as many months. The first one was for my grandson (age 8) and his sister (age 5-1/2) has been riding it since. The second one is for her. The manufacturer should take into consideration that girls like riding these as well and make them in pink or red. I'm going to have to bling it out for her. My grandson is a little shorter than most his age and my granddaughter is a little taller; but they have no problem with their legs reaching. Assembly was easy; I put it together and my husband tightened it up a little. All in all, I think I've hit a homerun with this item.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it...adults wish they could ride it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for Christmas for our daughter 9 and son 6....love them! It doesn't look like it but it's a very sturdy bike, watch out for longer legs though...our daughter is about 5 feet and she has to open her legs a bit wide and lean back to be able to ride the bike. We were going to give it to her little cousin...age 7 but she loves the bike so much she refuses to let it go. The seat doesn't adjust either. Otherwise tons of fun...my husband and I were trying to figure out how we can ride our kids were having so much fun. Keep children in a place without lots of traffic bikes sit really low.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia G.

customer_reviews.title: Rip Razor 360 WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Santa brought my 9yr old grandson a Rip Razor 360. Everyone thought it was just another bike. That was until he got on it and made it wiz around in circle, turning on a dime. He loves it and many people who have seen him on it have since gone on to buy one for their loved one. It is great fun. Try one. BTW, Santa's main elf said it was very easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: lyndep

customer_reviews.title: My son's favorite Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old son loves his new Razor Rip-Rider! He couldn't wait for warmer weather to try it out, so he bundled up and took it for a spin in the freezing weather. We couldn't get him off of it! I was hoping I could try it out since I don't exceed the weight limit--however, if you are taller than about 5 ft., you will be too tall to ride. The spinning back wheels make this Rip-Rider different and "way cooler" than the other big wheel-type riders my son has had before.
customer_reviews.author: bhester

customer_reviews.title: FUN FUN FUN!!
customer_reviews.text: we bought 2 razor-rip-riders for our 8 year old granddaughters. i put them together by my self (60 yr old female),which was not very hard. guys had to tighten the screws but other than that it as fine. the girls LOVED them. they had the best time!! one problem...the front tire is getting flat from so much use! they said it as the best gift they got this year.
customer_reviews.author: jense

customer_reviews.title: They love them!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 boys who all have a Rip-Rider and they love them. They really whip around! The only thing they ever complain about is that when they turn the front tire hits their legs. It didn't seem to impair their fun though. They seem well made despite many crashes into one another. They were pretty easy to put together too,
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: My son whom is 3 loves this ride on. He is tall for his age, and still we need to put some padding on the seat back to make him sit forward to reach the peddles. But with that done, he CAN reach the peddles, and he has SUCH fun on it. He can make it go in circles. I wish I had one in my size. Love this bike!
customer_reviews.author: MommyFirst

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sons 6Th birthday and he just turned 9. He still rides it every time he goes outside. It is faded from the sun but besides that it is still in great shape! This is so much more fun than a bike... !
customer_reviews.author: KaylaJean

customer_reviews.title: 3 years and still loving it
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my then 5 year old daughter. She loves it and still rides it 3 years later at age 8. This is bike that all the kids argue over who gets it next. Lots of fun. I would recommend it for a flat driveway... spinning on a hill can get dangerous for little ones that don't have control yet.
customer_reviews.author: L.Rock

customer_reviews.title: I ride this myself sometimes!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item for my nephew for Christmas and my expected delivery date was January 1st-4th. I received it by Christmas which was great. It puts together nicely and rides nice. My nephew loves it. The only thing is the front wheel steers a little crooked because the back wheels turn 360.
customer_reviews.author: ashers64

customer_reviews.title: Razor Does Rip
customer_reviews.text: I first saw this bike when my neigbor's son was riding it. I fell in love with it and said I would purchase for my five year old grandson. He received it for Christmas and has been riding it ever since. It combines a Big Wheel and bike together, that spins. Really awesome idea. A must buy!!
customer_reviews.author: rbelton44

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: What a great bike for kids of all ages. My son is 6 and is just LOVING it, but we have a few tweens in the neighborhood who also think its great to just spin out in the street. Im glad I didnt get the one with the spark thing cuz then my son would have to have only one hand on the handle bar as he turns, and you really do turn pretty quick- he just LOVES it.
customer_reviews.author: chops26

customer_reviews.title: Razor Rip Rider
customer_reviews.text: This toy is amazing. My 8 year old grand daughter loves it and rides it daily. It is low to the ground so she can safely spin circles without fear of tipping over. I have tried it out and I am 62 years old, my sister rode on it and she is 64 years old, so it is a fun bike for everyone. They just need to make a bigger one for adults! It is a little pricey, but if it holds up well it is worth the hours of fun the kids are having on it. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann

customer_reviews.title: Possibly The Funnest Outdoor Toy Ever
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old is a maniac on this thing! Kids in the neighborhood put down their motorized scooters to stand in line to ride the Rip Rider. If you want to see a child experience pure joy, and get a decent workout, this is it. I probably will need another for big sister so they stop fighting over who gets it next.
customer_reviews.author: stlouisbrad

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has had this bike for a few years and loves it as much as when we first bought it for her. It still looks like new. It's well made. Her younger brother is just now getting big enough to ride it. I even ride it (female, 130 lbs ) an it's so much fun!
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: "super fun"
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! Santa dropped this item off and my family couldn't be happier. I am the only one that hasn't taken it for a spin, believe me, I've been tempted. I've been told that it's, "super fun" and the huge grins on the faces of the persons riding it around make me a believer. Santa rocks! :)
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Nike Green

customer_reviews.title: Super. Fun.
customer_reviews.text: We have large children but this is perfect for ever growing kids. Super, easy to set up but with they had more colours to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Beezoh

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: Hid the Rip-rider outside on Christmas Eve. Sent 4-year old outside with a flashlight to find it after Santa "called" to tell him where a misdirected elf had left it. He disappeared around the corner of the house. next thing we heard, at full volume, "Thank you, Baby Jesus! Thank you!" He had the flu a week later, but since he'd left his 'Rider at Papi's, called Papi to ask to have it brought to him - with a fever of 102!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 11 year old son. Everyone in the neighborhood loves it and several other kids have bought them as a result (we now have two). Even the adults love it. Fun riding toy, drifting apparently never gets tiresome.
customer_reviews.author: AngelineM

customer_reviews.title: So Fun!
customer_reviews.text: We originally bought this for our 4-year-old, but our 7-year-old loves it, too. Starting out in a flat parking lot helped our 4-year-old learn to control the movement and 'drifting' - he's a pro on inclines and slopes now! The back wheels are similar to roller blade wheels, so it won't ride well in grass or other soft surfaces. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: little guys's mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is great value for the money, however, BEWARE that if you are buying this for a Christmas gift, it will arrive at your house in its original box, with a picture on the box and everything. My son spotted it in the garage immediately and the Christmas surprise was ruined !!
customer_reviews.author: Milinda

customer_reviews.title: Riding High
customer_reviews.text: After grandsons riding through two sets of tires on their Big Wheels,I decided they needed something stronger and different tires. I found the new razors. The boys simply love them and the wheel set up is very fun for them. They want to ride them all the time,even in the rain!!
customer_reviews.author: ellasmitherman

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun
customer_reviews.text: My kids have loved this. We have had it now for over a year and it's holding up well. Only a few minor crashes so I'd say it's overall a fairly safe product. I reccomend it for ages 5-10. However, my 12 year old girl will ride it now and then also.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great toy and sturdy too
customer_reviews.text: This has been such a hit with grand kids from ages 3-10. The bike is very sturdy and has held up to our desert sun as well as several intentional spinouts. As the grandchildren increased I'm probably going to invest in another soon
customer_reviews.author: srwalrath

customer_reviews.title: Too big for a three-year-old
customer_reviews.text: We purchased four for our grandchildren for Christmas. I'd rate it five stars for three of the kiddies, but no stars for the 3-year-old. No way did it fit her, despite the product description saying it's appropriate for 3 year olds. The slightly older grandchildren -- ages 4-8 -- love them!
customer_reviews.author: ljm1967

customer_reviews.title: Grandkid pleaser
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old grandson was so excited to open this huge package. He wanted one of these so bad as he had ridden it at his friend's house and couldn't stop talking about how "cool" it was. It is winter now in Michigan and he and his dad are putting it together so he can try it out in the garage on the cement.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne G. Valenti

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these from amazon right before Christmas primarily for my seven year old son & step son. We have three other children ranging from 15-9 and they all love them. All the neighborhood kids have been on them and love them. We live on a cul-de-sac so it is perfect for all the kids to ride. I thought they would like them, but they have far exceeded my expectations. Could have bought atleast two more. This is almost a can't miss buy.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: It is a year later after he received it on his bday and its still in great shape and all his friends want one as soon ...
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves this bike!! It is a year later after he received it on his bday and its still in great shape and all his friends want one as soon as they see it and try it!! Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Lilyounger

customer_reviews.title: So much fun for my 5 year old!!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this in 2010 for our almost 5 year old son. Since he received this, we have to beg him to ride his bike because this is all he wants to ride! He's generally afraid of riding fast on his bike, but on this he feels a lot more secure since he is lower to the ground and zips up and down our street. It was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Three daughters love it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My three girls (5, 9, 11) love this bike. I wish it had come in pink but they don't care. They make laps around the basement in it and race with their other plasma car. I would recommend this car- it keeps them busy for hours and is better than them laying around playing nintendo all the time :)
customer_reviews.author: Britt Du

customer_reviews.title: Be a Hero
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. It might be more of a winner if the seat position were in some way adjustable. You may have to use something on the pedals to help the youngsters with short legs. Very strong frame. Looks as if it will be virtually "bulletproof". This is the kind of gift that will make you a hero to your grandkids.
customer_reviews.author: NavyMan

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 4year old
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 11 year old and it fits him just fine. Although it was for the older son, my 4 year old rides it very well. He is a short little man and he just loves the spinning action. This item is great and fun
customer_reviews.author: Rolle

customer_reviews.title: my son's favorite ride
customer_reviews.text: My son goes crazy riding this to Lear his mind as crazy as it seems - wore his first one out getting his money's worth so this is his second one and so glad he is able to ride again year upon year
customer_reviews.author: JVB

customer_reviews.title: Rip Rider
customer_reviews.text: Quickly shipped, exactly as described. Came fully assembled. My child loved this bike, I have almost as much fun watching him ride it as he has riding it...They need to make an adult version!
customer_reviews.author: only me lori

customer_reviews.title: All the kids in the neighborhood loved riding it also
customer_reviews.text: My Grandson put many miles on these wheels. All the kids in the neighborhood loved riding it also. Sorry to say that it passed away a few months ago, and has had a proper burial. lol Great product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: C.J. Berscheidt

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a trip
customer_reviews.text: I wish I weighed NOT enough to ride this thing, or had one when I was a kid. Its like a big wheel, as you can see. But the caster wheels on it give it that extra "umph" to make it awesome. Ive watched my son ride it, and it is just awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M Cook

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, reliable and fun!
customer_reviews.text: This Ride-on toy I expect to have its issues like many others have but truly it has been perfect. Once we assembled it we have not had a single problem with it. Sturdy, and has made it in a house full of boys on it. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Steidinger

customer_reviews.title: The best Christmas present ever!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boys after they rode it at their cousins. They LOVE it. I bought it for my short (18th percentile) 4 year old. We put a pillow in the seat and he was good to go. It's the toy all the kids want to ride on when they come over.
customer_reviews.author: AirForceMom

customer_reviews.title: great gift
customer_reviews.text: I have never written a review on a.product before but am happy to give my.two cents on this product. I got my 7 year old son.the 360 razor for Christmas. It was easy to put together and seems quite durable. Since we have snow I let.him and my 9 year old daughter ride it in the house. What.fun!! It does.not.harm.the.hard wood and corners so smoothly! The actual 360 spinning is really.cool. I would recommend the child be at least 48 inched to really.enjoy the bike. I am 5'3" and was.able to take it for. quick spin : )
customer_reviews.author: mom2kids

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!!
customer_reviews.text: My seven year old has been riding this daily since he got it, and he absolutely loves it! It is sturdy and well-built and will hopefully last him a long time. The spins are way better than my Big Wheel that I rode as a kid until it fell apart. This is so fun and totally worth the money!! I recommend getting elbow pads if you are buying this for a young rider though. Until they get used to the feel of how to make the spins happens, expect a few dumps and some degree of road rash. Nothing major, but elbow pads should do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Lorkor

customer_reviews.title: My child hardly used it, it just made him ...
customer_reviews.text: My child hardly used it, it just made him dizzy. and he complained that it hurt his behind. Caution: for small children, because my son outgrew it fast!
customer_reviews.author: Raggedy Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge hit. It was easy to put together. It seems sturdy. The (small) nine year old who received it didn't get off of it for days. No regrets on this one. It was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: taaj

customer_reviews.title: awsome
customer_reviews.text: arrived early, and in great shape. It is lots of fun, the only reason its 4 stars not 5 is because my son, age 5, cannot ride it down a regular sidewalk due to the constant drifting action. I knew it was a feature, but did not understand just how hard it would be to steer straight
customer_reviews.author: tracy

customer_reviews.title: Get this trike!
customer_reviews.text: Everything is as the description stated. We have a 5 year old boy that got this bike for his birthday. He is a larger than average boy, especially in his height and this bike works perfect for him. We had bought a radio flyer spin out trike for him for Christmas and it broke within a month. He just got this bike but it seems WAY better built and I hope it will last a LONG time! He loves the spinning and low riding fun he has on this bike!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for our 7-yr-old, and he absolutely loves it! It is great for smaller riding spaces like driveways, but really fun for larger paved areas like when we ride it at the school blacktop. Really fun, and I can also ride it, as well as my 4-yr old (just slower of course). Highly recommend it and it seems to be really sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: lindsnorbs

customer_reviews.title: Fun Bike per my grandson
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old grandson had fun with it. I think he prefers this bike to the regular bike that he already have. Because it is low to the ground even when he fell no big deal for him. Mom did not worry. Five stars at least from my observation.
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: Fun while it lasts!
customer_reviews.text: I got this Razor Rip-Rider for my daughter for Christmas last year (2011), she has ridden it a lot and has had lots of fun, but after 6 weeks and every few months since I have to replace the bolts that hold the front tire on (tightening the bolts when they come loose only works temporarily), also it would be nice if you could get reasonably priced replacement castors, if they are available I haven't found them yet. It's a great concept but cheaply but together.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stroup

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun! It'd be cool if it were made in adult sizes.
customer_reviews.text: We got this trike for our 6 year old's birthday because I wanted to ride it. I love it. My brother came over with his family for Thanksgiving and now his girls are getting rip riders for Christmas. It'd be nice if it came in adult sizes (my brother and cousin 6' and 220 lbs. rode it around for a while, too). It's a little awkward since our knees come up to our arm pits, but still fun. And the younger kids LOVE riding it. One thing to mention, the rip rider comes in it's own box when it's shipped to you...so no hiding the surprise if your kids see the delivery man come.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johns

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these 360 bikes. The price was much better than in any local store. My husband put them together for our two grandkids birthday's (ages 6 and 10). They were very well made and quite simple to put together. The only thing my husband recommended that it was easier assembling the seat first and then the rest. The kids love them and it was so much fun watching the kids race. They looked like little bugs scooting around. What a hoot!!
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for Grandsons
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 Razor Rip-riders 360 last Christmas for my grandsons ages 4 & 7. What a great buy! Both boys are tall for their ages. They have used them repeatedly and are definitely "rough-riders". The razors survived the year in great condition and I am confident will survive at least 1 or 2 more years. Helmets are a good thing as the razors will tip.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene M

customer_reviews.title: Huge confidence builder!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old enjoyed trying out the Rip Rider that our neighbor bought his kids, so I got one for her birthday. She started off just using it as a regular trike (she rides a bicycle, too) but was soon building confidence and letting the back end go while keeping her feet up. I am very pleased with the product, both in design and quality.
customer_reviews.author: PJN

customer_reviews.title: great fun
customer_reviews.text: Our kids love this toy. We had to buy a second one because they fight over it. It is great fun, and I have even taken a spin. Seems to be holding up well, have had it since Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Jcfl160

customer_reviews.title: loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's 11th birthday. He wanted it badly. Great price through Amazon, & came pretty quickly. He was not disappointed except for the fact the seat length is not adjustable. The weight limit is plenty high, so no worries there, but also assumed the seat would be adjustable for his growing legs. He still loves it though & rides it about everytime he goes outside. So thanks Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: COCO

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my son, but...
customer_reviews.text: It's so much fun, with the 160 lb weight limit, I must admit to taking quite a few spins myself. It's easy to assemble and super fun to ride. My neighbor and her son tried it out, as well. I wouldn't be surprised to see them with one soon. :o)
customer_reviews.author: M. Steele

customer_reviews.title: Razor Rip Rider very fun, but Amazon disapointed me!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift from Santa, and while it was exactly what my 11 year old wanted I need to warn other parents that Amazon just ships this in the box - no overpack! So my child saw the box with all the pictures on it sitting on the front porch one day. I was truly disappointed in Amazon that they shipped a toy during the holiday season in the regular packing with no overpack. Any time of year toys should be overpacked so parents have a chance to hide the box before the kids see it! So the bike is great, but I will think twice before I order an oversized product like this from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: TAH

customer_reviews.title: no company support
customer_reviews.text: We were very disappointed with the customer support from razor. The rear wheels come threaded and are screwed into the frame. The frame threads were filled with welding splatter making it impossible to thread the wheels into the frame. Razors response was to call the retailer, the retailers response was what the box said to call the company, we finally found a machine shop that recut the threads.............this is my last Razor product
customer_reviews.author: T Jim

customer_reviews.title: Ripping good fun!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a Rip-Rider for our 10 year old son and he absolutely loves it! The drifting action makes the ride really unique and fun. We customized it by sanding the seat, handle bar divider and wheel and spray painting it black (sorry Razor) and it looks great. Our 12 year old son borrowed it so much, he saved up and bought himself one. The rear wheels wear out quickly, order more when you order your Rider. We highly recommed this product.
customer_reviews.author: BeeVeeSee

customer_reviews.title: razor rip  is razor sharp
customer_reviews.text: very easy to assemble. kinda bummed that decals were affixed prior to shipping(actually this would have been cool but the decals were not put on with any care lotsa bubbles etc.) . this thing is so cool. only problem is the bike really performs only for older children. my teen daughters worked this thing out no prob. my 5 yr. old had trouble getting the hang of the "skidding". awesome bike!!! this blows any other toys r us crap big wheel outta the water. good old fashion metal assembly(not plastic garbage)
customer_reviews.author: dsn johnson

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my 7 year old grandson's birthday...OMG! What a hit! I was wishin' I was small enough to try it out myself! He immediately took it our to our patio (IN THE SNOW/ICE!) & was having a blast!!!
customer_reviews.author: Terri

product_meta.title: Razor Rip-Rider 360 Drifting Ride-On
product_meta.description:
Razor RipRider 360 Caster Trike Blue

The Razor RipRider 360 is the successor to the classic three-wheeler of the 1970s and features innovative dual-inclined caster wheels. The casters allow resistance-free drifting and spinning action, and the steel-framed design offers durability and looks cool. The double-crown fork and oversize front wheel with a rugged pneumatic tire offer a smooth ride, and the rubber hand grips are easy and comfortable to hold.

 * Product Measures: 27.13" x 10" x 23.25"
 * Recommended Ages: 6 - 12 years
feature_bullets: Dual inclined rear-casters allow resistance-free drifting and spinning action
Rugged, long-lasting all steel frame and double crown fork
MX-Style handlebar with rubber grips; 3-piece crank
Recommended for children aged 5 and up; 6-month warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
